function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'isqrti' to reach function 'main'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'isqrt'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'bit > num' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'bit > num' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'bit != 0' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'bit != 0' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'bit > num' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'bit != 0' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'num (line 2)' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'res (line 3)' used after its definition?
liveness: Does variable 'num (line 2)' remain in use at the end of function 'isqrt'?
Is variable 'res (line 3)' live at the end of function 'isqrt'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'int main() {' be considered dead code?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “bit >>= 2;”?
